info.title: Digital Capability Publisher (DCP) interface specification
info.description:
The "Digital Capability Publisher" (DCP) provides the ability to discover detailed service information and associated digital certificates for any known business identifier.

Please mind the test installation and ensure data validity - some of such installations have data like in production, with real businesses, but this data is not guaranteed to be valid and may be changed in development purposes; do not rely on data from specific hostname to real-world production installation until service owners specifically said it's true and valid. For example, any *.testpoint.io installations have the test data and can't be used in production.

This API specification should be valid for all supporting installations and implementations.

If you want OASIS XML output:
* pass Accept header with 'application/xml' or 'text/xml' value
* pass ?format=xml as GET query parameter

OASIS-compliant urls also supported (but it is strongy recommended to implement json, just because JSON is more flexible and contains more information). Examples:

* https://dcp.testpoint.io/urn:oasis:names:tc:ebcore:partyid-type:iso6523:0151::22341388307?format=xml
* https://dcp.testpoint.io/urn:oasis:names:tc:ebcore:partyid-type:iso6523:0151::22341388307/service/dbc::invoice?format=xml  
Despite Oasis SMP standard prohibit using SSL/TLS, DPC implementation speicfication defines HTTPS as a signle supported protocol.
Please note that JSON format differs from specification XML and has more data in it.

If you want to do any authenticated test requests then it's better to use CURL, not Swaggerhub website.

JWT.description:
JWT token value prepended by `JWT`, for example:
`JWT XXXXX.YYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYYY.ZZZZZZ`
You can get your JWT for testpoint.io services at https://idp.testpoint.io/
JWT.name: Authorization

fingerprintParameter.name: fingerprint
fingerprintParameter.description: value of fingerprint (should be not less than 40 characteres)

participantIdUrlParameter.name: participant_id
participantIdUrlParameter.description: The participant identifier. Comprises the identifier, and an identifier scheme. This identifier MUST have the same value of the {id} part of the URI of the enclosing ServiceMetadata resource.

linkedParticipantIdUrlParameter.name: linked_participant_id
linkedParticipantIdUrlParameter.description: The participant identifier. Comprises the identifier, and an identifier scheme. This identifier MUST have the same value of the {id} part of the URI of the enclosing ServiceMetadata resource.

documentIdUrlParameter.name: document_id
documentIdUrlParameter.description: Represents the type of document that the recipient is able to receive. The document is represented by an identifier (identifying the document type) and an identifier scheme, which the format of the identifier itself.

notRevokedBefore.name: notRevokedBefore
notRevokedBefore.description: Filter parameter for keys never revoked or revoked lately than given time (in ISO 8601 format)

published_before.name: published_before
published_before.description: Filter parameter for keys published before given time (in ISO 8601 format)

400.description: The server cannot or will not process the request due to something that is perceived to be a client error.

401.description: Invalid auth header. No credentials provided.

403.description: The server understood the request, but is refusing to fulfill it. Return this if there is a problem with the client certificate.

404.description: The origin server did not find a current representation of the target resource or is not willing to disclose that one exists.

406.description: The resource identified by the request is only capable of generating response entities which have content characteristics not acceptable according to the accept headers sent in the request.

500.description: Internal server error; no action required; may help to retry request later or contact support.

403-key.description:
* Participant id {participant_id}} not available for given user - not business owner
* Invalid auth header. No credentials provided.
* Badly formed JWT
* Invalid Authorization header. JWT Signature verification failed.

date.description: The date and time that the message was originated.

ServiceEndpointList.ServiceDescription: TAP-GW Service Endpoint for AusDigital BILL Tax Invoice documents.
TAP-GW Service Endpoint for AusDigital BILL Invoice Adjustment documents.

value.description: The unique ID within the scheme
The unique ID within the scheme
The unique ID within the scheme

code.description: The code associated with the error.

name.description: The name category for the error.

errors.name: Authentication Failed
errors.userMessage: Invalid auth header. No credentials provided.

errors.name: Permission Denied
errors.userMessage: Participant id urn:oasis:names:tc:ebcore:partyid-type:iso6523:0151::99998888779 not available for given user - not business owner
